subject: Re: [junit] Can any friend tell me about how to simulate HttpServletRequest & HttpServeltResponse & HttpSenssion.
msgSnippet: thx! But I only know Easymock is a framework for unit test interface. I have made some practice of Easymock for testing interface. It is a wonderful tools make
messageBody:
thx!
But I only know Easymock is a framework for unit test interface. I have made some practice of Easymock for testing interface. It is a wonderful tools make interface test easy.
My class is such like this:
 
public Collection process (HttpServletRequest req, HttpServetResponse res, ActionCode acode)
                    throws ApplicationException
I want to test function 'process'
----- Original Message -----
From: Shane Duan
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, November 07, 2001 4:51 PM
Subject: Re: [junit] Can any friend tell me about how to simulate HttpServletRequest & HttpServeltResponse & HttpSenssion.

Since HttpServletRequest and HttpServletResponse are both interface, I
would personally strongly suggest the EasyMock, whcih can be found at
the following link:

http://tammofreese.de/easymock/index.html


--
Disclaimer:  I join all the news groups out of my own interest.  All opinions expressed here are my own and not necessarily those of my employer.


FrankSun wrote:

> For our project is base on Servlet&Jsp tech, and we want to unit test
> out class.
>
> When a class use HttpServletRequest & HttpServetResponse object, and I
> test it not under the real enginee(tomcat).How to construct a request
> and response and session?
>
> Thx a lot.
